data.title: Change trackpad hint name
data.body: Had an issue using the term "3D" without the editor creating whitespace between those characters. Used "Enable Trackpad" instead. Closes #5254.

data.title: Add missing license headers in our files
data.body: All done.

data.title: Rename "trackpad hint" to something more intuitive like "Enable 3D trackpad"
data.body:
I recently checked the history for the spatial_editor_plugin class and saw that somebody had made the feature I added optional, however, I wasn't able to easily verify because it was named something that I don't think is intuitive for users: "trackpad hint".

Could we please rename this something much more obvious? "Trackpad hint" doesn't describe the feature in question, in fact, it sounds more like a "help" or "accessibility" thing for the editor. I've suggested an alternative in the title of this ticket, and would be open to discussion about what the new name should be.

data.title: OpenGameArt integration in asset manager
data.body:
[OpenGameArt](http://opengameart.org) is by far the best resource around for assets released under free licenses (except for samples, but [Freesound](http://freesound.org/) sadly has a lot of NC and ND stuff, but since they have an API they're also worth taking a look at).

Right now it could easily be done via scraping (with the webmaster's consent, obviously, otherwise it's just rude and unethical) or by mirroring all the content on the Godot server (and since it's all under free licenses, it would not be an issue, and it would also spare them some bandwidth costs) but the people at [OpenGameArt](http://opengameart.org) a while ago talked about releasing their site under a FLOSS license if a funding goal was reached, which would allow an API to be implemented.

I suggest therefore that OpenGameArt is integrated into Godot.

data.title: Dropping webpold driver
data.body: The new webp version seems to work fine, I don't think we need to keep the backup copy?

data.title: Can't Add More Specific Lines to Godot's build.gradle from an Android module's config.py
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 Pro, latest from Godot's GitHub repo that can be compiled successfully. 
Compiling release template for **Android**.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I am trying to use this [module](https://github.com/ranmaru90/Play-Game-Services-Android-Module-for-Godot/) which I forked from [Blubee's](https://github.com/teamblubee/bbGGPS) and refactored, cleaned up and added leaderboards to it.

After updating the Android SDK to the latest version, Google's API [has changed to have some of it using Firebase](https://developers.google.com/android/guides/releases). When compiling the release export template for Android with the latest Android SDK from Google, it can only be compiled successfully.

But when actually exporting the game as release apk using that template, and then installing the apk on an Android device (Android 5.0++), the game crashes right after running it with these from logcat:

```
E/AndroidRuntime( 9750): java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to get provider com.google.firebase.provider.FirebaseInitProvider: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Incorrect provider authority in manifest. Most likely due to a missing applicationId variable in application's build.gradle.
E/AndroidRuntime( 9750):        at android.app.ActivityThread.installProvider(ActivityThread.java:5029)
E/AndroidRuntime( 9750):        at android.app.ActivityThread.installContentProviders(ActivityThread.java:4621)
E/AndroidRuntime( 9750):        at android.app.ActivityThread.handleBindApplication(ActivityThread.java:4561)
E/AndroidRuntime( 9750):        at android.app.ActivityThread.access$1600(ActivityThread.java:151)
E/AndroidRuntime( 9750):        at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage(ActivityThread.java:1379)
E/AndroidRuntime( 9750):        at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:102)
E/AndroidRuntime( 9750):        at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:135)
E/AndroidRuntime( 9750):        at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5281)
E/AndroidRuntime( 9750):        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
E/AndroidRuntime( 9750):        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:372)
E/AndroidRuntime( 9750):        at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:904)
E/AndroidRuntime( 9750):        at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:699)
E/AndroidRuntime( 9750): Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Incorrect provider authority in manifest. Most likely due to a missing applicationId variable in application's build.gradle.
E/AndroidRuntime( 9750):        at com.google.firebase.provider.FirebaseInitProvider.zza(Unknown Source)
E/AndroidRuntime( 9750):        at com.google.firebase.provider.FirebaseInitProvider.attachInfo(Unknown Source)
E/AndroidRuntime( 9750):        at android.app.ActivityThread.installProvider(ActivityThread.java:5026)
E/AndroidRuntime( 9750):        ... 11 more
W/ActivityManager(  695):   Force finishing activity 1 org.twistedcats.laddergrowl/org.godotengine.godot.Godot
```

And the workaround to fix this problem is to modify Godot's build.gradle, or in this case build.gradle.template and add such a following line:

`applicationId "com.company.appname"`

to the **defaultConfig** section.

but there is no way to do this from within the module itself using the **config.py** and the env.android_....methods() as we always have to go to build.gradle.template to modify that file manually. 

and we don't have a way of accessing the game's "com.company.appname" via a variable from the **config.py** file in a module? So we always have to add the line manually and add the "com.company.appname" manually to build.gradle.template to avoid the crash and error messages.

**Steps to reproduce:**
0. You need to have an Android Developer's account to access and set up the app in your Developer's Console in order to test and reproduce this.
1. git clone https://github.com/ranmaru90/Play-Game-Services-Android-Module-for-Godot.git
2. follow the instructions on that module's page and add the module to Godot's source then compile for Android, release template.
3. use the release template to export a game, as release.
4. install the exported release apk in your Android device, then run it.
5. it crashes. check your logcat.
6. then go to Godot's build.gradle.template.
7. then add the applicationId "com.company.appname" line, replace the package name with your own.
8. repeat the steps 2 - 5.

data.title: Add sha256 to String and File/FileAccess.
data.body:
Probably does #4166

I haven't tested `String::sha256_text` yet, but I'm positive that `FileAccess::get_sha256` results in the same as `sha256sum` on linux.

Labling with assetlib since it is required for some security aspects there.

data.title: VS14.0 compilation error C2466: cannot allocate an array of constant size 0
data.body:

Windows 10 Pro - Godot's source from GitHub, commit f0d9245ecf981dada4595da0e525cc95a0caf785

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When trying to compile using the Visual Studio command prompt:

scons platform=windows target=release_debug tools=yes

d:\devworkfolder\godot\git_repos_godot\godot\scene\resources\default_theme\font_lodpi.inc(199): error C2466: cannot allocate an array of constant size 0

d:\devworkfolder\godot\git_repos_godot\godot\scene\resources\default_theme\font_hidpi.inc(199): error C2466: cannot allocate an array of constant size 0
d:\devworkfolder\godot\git_repos_godot\godot\scene\resources\default_theme\font_hidpi.inc(200): error C2466: cannot allocate an array of constant size 0
scons: **\* [scene\resources\default_theme\default_theme.windows.opt.tools.32.obj] Error 2

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Checkout commit f0d9245ecf981dada4595da0e525cc95a0caf785
2. vcvarsall.bat && scons platform=windows target=release_debug tools=yes

data.title: [TRACKER] External libraries and their versions
data.body:
This issue is meant to keep track of all external libraries that we embed in our source tree with their version, and for comparison's sake the current upstream version and/or latest upstream version of the same stable branch.

As upstream projects continue updating their libraries regularly, we'll keep this tracker around and use different issues (linked here) to handle specific updates.

---
## Core

| Library | Path | Local version | Upstream version | Update needed |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| [aes256](http://www.literatecode.com/aes256) | core/io/aes256.* | 2011 | 2011 | No |
| [base64](http://episec.com/people/edelkind/c.html) | core/io/base64.* | ? | ? | Check |
| [fastlz](https://code.google.com/archive/p/fastlz) | core/io/fastlz.* | svn | svn | No |
| [hq2x](https://github.com/brunexgeek/hqx) | core/hq2x.cpp | git (2016, modified) | git (2016) | No |
| [md5]() | core/io/md5.* | ? | ? | Check |
| [minizip](http://www.winimage.com/zLibDll/minizip.html) | core/io/{crypt.h,ioapi.\*,unzip.\*,zip.\*} | 1.1 (2010) | ? (contrib in zlib) | Yes |
| [sha256](https://github.com/ilvn/SHA256) | core/io/sha256.* | 2015 | 2015 | No |
| [smaz](https://github.com/antirez/smaz) | core/compressed_translation.cpp | git (2012) | git (2012) | No |
| [triangulator](https://github.com/ivanfratric/polypartition/blob/master/src/polypartition.cpp) (polypartition) | core/math/triangulator.* | ? | git (2015) | Check |

## Drivers

| Library | Path | Local version | Upstream version | Update needed |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Box2D Polygon/Triangle? | drivers/convex_decomp | ? (2007) | ? | Check |

## Modules

| Library | Path | Local version | Upstream version | Update needed |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| [cURL](https://curl.haxx.se/) (only snippets) | modules/openssl/{curl_hostcheck.*, stream_peer_openssl.cpp} | ? (2013) | 7.50.3 (2016) | Check |
| [ENet](http://enet.bespin.org) | modules/enet | git master (mid August 2016) | 1.3.13 | No |
## Platform

**Android**

Android Open Source Project / Google:
- `java/aidl/com/android/vending/billing` (duplicate), `java/com/android/vending/billing` (2012)
- `java/com/android/vending/licensing`
- `java/com/google/android/vending/expansion/downloader`
- `java/org/godotengine/godot/input/InputManager*`
- `android_native_app_glue.*`
- `cpu-features.*`

libjingle / Google:
- `ifaddrs_android.*`

**BlackBerry 10**
- `bbutil.*`

**UWP**
- `include/`
- `app.*`

## Scene
- `scene/resources/mikktspace.*` (2011)
- `scene/resources/stb_truetype.h` v1.11 (2015)

## Servers

**Physics**

Bullet:
- `servers/physics/gjk_epa.cpp` (snippet)

Chipmunk:
- `servers/physics/joints_sw.cpp` (snippet)
- `servers/physics/joints_2d_sw.cpp` (snippet)

## Thirdparty

| Library | Path | Local version | Upstream version | Update needed |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| [FreeType](https://www.freetype.org/) | thirdparty/freetype | 2.6.5 | 2.7.2 (2016) | Yes |
| [GLEW](http://glew.sourceforge.net/) | thirdparty/glew | 1.13.0 | 2.0 (2016) | Yes (2.1 only) |
| [jpgd](https://github.com/richgel999/jpeg-compressor) (jpeg-compressor) | thirdparty/jpeg-compressor | 1.04 | 1.04 (2012) | No |
| [libmpcdec](https://www.musepack.net/index.php?pg=src) | thirdparty/libmpcdec | SVN snapshot between 1.2.6 and SV8 | 1.2.6 (deprec.), SV8 (r475) | Check |
| [libogg](http://www.xiph.org/downloads/) | thirdparty/libogg | 1.3.2 | 1.3.2 (2014) | No |
| [libpng](http://www.libpng.org/pub/png/libpng.html) | thirdparty/libpng | 1.6.28 | 1.6.28 (2016) | No |
| [libsquish](https://code.google.com/archive/p/libsquish) | thirdparty/squish | ? | 1.11 (2011, some more recent SVN commits) | Check |
| [libtheora](http://www.xiph.org/downloads/) | thirdparty/libtheora | 1.1.1 | 1.1.1 (2010) | No |
| [libvorbis](http://www.xiph.org/downloads/) | thirdparty/libvorbis | 1.3.5 | 1.3.5 (2015) | No |
| [libwebp](https://chromium.googlesource.com/webm/libwebp) | thirdparty/libwebp | 0.5.2 | 0.5.2 (2016) | No |
| [OpenSSL](https://www.openssl.org/) | thirdparty/openssl | 1.0.2h | 1.0.2j and 1.1.0c (2016) | Yes |
| [opus](http://www.opus-codec.org/) | thirdparty/opus | 1.1.3 | 1.1.3 (2016) | No |
| [opusfile](http://www.opus-codec.org/) | thirdparty/opus | 0.8 | 0.8 (2016) | No |
| [pvrtccompressor](https://bitbucket.org/jthlim/pvrtccompressor) | thirdparty/pvrtccompressor | hg tip | hg tip (2015) | No |
| [rg_etc1](https://github.com/richgel999/rg-etc1) | thirdparty/rg-etc1 | 1.04 | 1.04 (2013) | No |
| [RtAudio](https://www.music.mcgill.ca/~gary/rtaudio/) | thirdparty/rtaudio | 4.1.2 | 4.1.2 (2016) | No |
| [zlib](http://zlib.net/) | thirdparty/zlib | 1.2.10 | 1.2.10 (2016) | No |

## Tools
- `tools/certs/ca-certificates.crt`

data.title: Changing scene after three yields closes the game.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu Linux / 2.1 alpha official

**Issue description**:
Having three or more yield within a function (it also happens if the yields are in different scripts) and reloading or changing the scene after those yields are already over closes the game. **It only happens with three yields or more**.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Set three yields in "_ready": `yield(get_tree(), "fixed_frame")` and then reload the current scene: `get_tree().reload_current_scene()` when pressing a key.
![screenshot from 2016-06-16 17-52-10](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6760623/16134433/1f3d42b4-33eb-11e6-96f6-2b921d828e9c.png)

**Link to minimal example project**:
[YieldDemo.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/319396/YieldDemo.zip)

data.title: Editor UI clipping on the right side if animation dock is opened with a long animation name
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu 15.04 - 1366x768 resolution screen
Godot 2.0.3 stable

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Editor UI clips out of the window, when the animation dock is opened and the animation name is lengthy.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Maximize the editor to the desktop screen.
2. Add a Node2D
3. Add an AnimationPlayer node as the child of the Node2D
4. Open the animation dock, create a lengthy animation name such as "sprite_alpha_fade_test_animation_clip"
5. May need to close and open the dock once more
6. See the editor UI clipped to the right side.
7. The UI also clips if the dropdown box width is increased when we tap the Autoplay button and the icon is placed inside the dropdown.

Seems like the UI is pushed to the right side in order to display the full animation text inside the dropdown box in the animation panel.

data.title: Silence compiler warnings from external dependencies
data.body:
We should have SCons silence the compiler warnings related to external dependencies (openssl, theora, etc.).

Those warnings are not relevant for us as we won't touch the upstream source to fix them, they should be handled directly upstream. They also tend to make our Travis logs huge and sometimes I get stalled builds because of this verbosity.

data.title: Clean up editor theme creation
data.body:
Allow editor to load custom themes generated with itself.

Fix #5184.

![](https://cdn.rawgit.com/Geequlim/depot/master/images/godot/costum_theme.png)

data.title: Default editor layout
data.body:
The current default layout in 2.1-dev is:
![spectacle p15397](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/16107604/a6a14154-339d-11e6-88e6-2189101d26d1.png)

It has the advantage of exhibiting the cool new feature of the Filesystem dock, but at the same time I'm not sure it's the most meaningful when starting a project. I preferred to have the Scene dock on the top left, as it's the most important one, and to have the inspector on the right.

My own simple layout is:
![spectacle z15397](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/16107540/58618940-339d-11e6-96d6-a46a03343d3d.png)
I think it would make a better default (it's quite similar to 2.0).

As an alternative, I'd propose also this one, with all docks directly visible, thus making sure new users don't miss the new Node dock:
![spectacle r15397](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/16107576/7a17da30-339d-11e6-8920-c35d680eb0cd.png)

data.title: Added AppImage structure
data.body: This will allow the distribution of AppImages for linux

data.title: Add support for an X11 ARMv7h export template
data.body:
I wanted to know if there was a way to include the ARMv7h compiler toolchain with the engine so that users could export to X11 ARMv7h platforms (Raspberry Pi 2 and related ARMv7h boards)?

Since those SoCs are very cheap, I think pivoting to embedded systems like these could broaden our audience.

Let me know your thoughts!

data.title: Visible path editor icons, fixes #5228
fix errors while exporting android
data.body:
application label and activity label comes from values/string.xml and resources.arsc in exported APK.
it's resource not a string.

```
<resources>
    <string name="godot_project_name_string">godot-project-name</string>
    ....
</resources>
```

so below error occurrs when export to android.

```
Application name in a resource, should be plaintext (but you can ignore this).
Activity name in a resource, should be plaintext (but you can ignore this)
```

it actually does nothing with current code.

and regarding this information with `aapt`

```
Android manifest:
N: android=http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android
  E: manifest (line=2)
    A: android:versionCode(0x0101021b)=(type 0x10)0x1
    A: android:versionName(0x0101021c)="1.0" (Raw: "1.0")
    A: android:installLocation(0x010102b7)=(type 0x10)0x0
    A: package="com.godot.game" (Raw: "com.godot.game")
    A: platformBuildVersionCode=(type 0x10)0x17 (Raw: "23")
    A: platformBuildVersionName="6.0-2704002" (Raw: "6.0-2704002")
    E: uses-sdk (line=8)
      A: android:minSdkVersion(0x0101020c)=(type 0x10)0xe
      A: android:targetSdkVersion(0x01010270)=(type 0x10)0x17
    E: supports-screens (line=12)
      A: android:smallScreens(0x01010284)=(type 0x12)0xffffffff
      A: android:normalScreens(0x01010285)=(type 0x12)0xffffffff
      A: android:largeScreens(0x01010286)=(type 0x12)0xffffffff
      A: android:xlargeScreens(0x010102bf)=(type 0x12)0xffffffff
    E: uses-feature (line=18)
      A: android:glEsVersion(0x01010281)=(type 0x11)0x20000
```

support-screens attribute values are also not string.
so removed checking if it's string.
now exports to android without error and works properly for screen attributes.

tested with each screen option on / off.
and tested about application name with nexus 9, nexus 6p, note 2 devices.

fixes #4144.

this PR supersedes #5135, but #5135 can be merged for clean code. (only largeScreens is false).
it's up to dev team. :)

data.title: Shading language parser issue with retrieving vectors from matrices
data.body:
Godot 2.0.3-stable

Looking at documentation on http://docs.godotengine.org/en/latest/reference/shading_language.html at the bottom of the page there is a "Obtaining world-space normal and position in material fragment program". The code does not work, seems like multiple vector extractions and swizzling is not supported properly. Also `mat3(INV_CAMERA_MATRIX)` does not work (invalid constructor argument).

`INV_CAMERA_MATRIX.w.xyz` does not work, while `(INV_CAMERA_MATRIX.w).xyz` is parsed properly.

Original code:

```
vec3 world_normal = NORMAL * mat3(INV_CAMERA_MATRIX);
vec3 world_pos = (VERTEX - INV_CAMERA_MATRIX.w.xyz) * mat3(INV_CAMERA_MATRIX);
```

Working code:

```
vec3 world_normal = NORMAL * mat3((INV_CAMERA_MATRIX.x).xyz, (INV_CAMERA_MATRIX.y).xyz, (INV_CAMERA_MATRIX.z).xyz);
vec3 world_pos = (VERTEX.xyz - (INV_CAMERA_MATRIX.w).xyz) * mat3((INV_CAMERA_MATRIX.x).xyz, (INV_CAMERA_MATRIX.y).xyz, (INV_CAMERA_MATRIX.z).xyz);
```

Also... after adding a `EMISSION = world_pos;` the result is still in screen-space... So I guess there's a parser and a documentation error here.

_EDIT:_
I did this in the fragment shader for a material, which is marked as "out" in the documentation... weird.

data.title: List of favorite plugins in Asset Lib
data.body:
There's a discussion about global vs. local plugins in #2537 and there's no intent to add global plugins _a priori_.

Then I propose a way to keep a list of favorite plugins in the asset library, so we can quickly install them in new projects. This will avoid the need of searching and filtering the plugins we use the most every time we make a new project.

data.title: StreamPlayer: added "started", "stopped" signals, fixed "finished"
data.body:
- fixes #5222
- added "started" and "stopped" signal, started is emitted on
  play(), stopped is emitted on stop() but only if the StreamPlayer
  was playing at that time.
- "finished" is now emitted only when the StreamPlayer stops naturally
